programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Ottawa avoided elimination with a 4-3 win in overtime over Toronto in Game 4 behind a game-winner from Jake Sanderson in the extra period and 31 saves from Linus Ullmark; Oliver Ekman-Larsson tied it for the Maple Leafs in the third period.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Vegas evened the series at two games apiece with a 4-3 overtime win over Minnesota in Game 4 behind a game-winner from Ivan Barbashev; Jared Spurgeon tied it for the Wild in the third period and Filip Gustavsson had 42 saves in the loss.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Washington gained a commanding 3-1 series lead with a 5-2 win over Montreal in Game 4 behind two goals from Brandon Duhaime, along with a goal and an assist from Dylan Strome; Juraj Slafkovsky and Cole Caufield scored for the Canadiens.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: NFL2Night
programme.desc: The latest news and reports around the NFL are discussed in detail with a panel of expert analysts weighing in on the hottest issues, while veteran football reporters provide up-to-date information from team headquarters across the league.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: Women's Super League
programme.desc: Chelsea claimed a 1-0 victory against Manchester United in their first meeting of the season on Nov. 24 through a penalty conversion from Guro Reiten; Chelsea's Lucy Bronze recorded 7 interceptions and 3 tackles in the win at home.

programme.title: 2025 Stanley Cup Playoffs
programme.desc: Florida gained a commanding 3-1 series lead with a 4-2 win over Tampa Bay in Game 4 behind third period goals from Aaron Ekblad, Seth Jones and Carter Verhaeghe; Mitchell Chaffee and Erik Cernak scored for the Lightning in the loss.

programme.title: Hey Rookie, Welcome to the NFL
programme.desc: Cameras follow the newest members of the NFL as they go through the draft, preseason, training camp, numerous hazing rituals instigated by veteran players, and an assortment of other situations that will test each rookie's mettle.

programme.title: College Beach Volleyball
programme.desc: The NCAA's women's beach volleyball season culminates with the 2025 championship consisting of 16 teams and headlined by No. 1 ranked UCLA and No. 2 TCU; USC claimed a 3-0 victory against North Florida in the first round of 2024's tournament.

programme.title: One More Round: Inoue vs. Nery
programme.desc: Naoya Inoue stepped into the ring for what was to be a crowning moment in his career, but his junior featherweight title defense against Luis Nery would bring with it something that never happened, an Inoue knockdown and the challenge to bounce back.

programme.title: Professional Fighters League
programme.desc: Featured heavyweight bouts: Valentin Moldavsky vs. Sergey Bilostenniy; Alexander Romanov vs. Tim Johnson; featured light heavyweight bouts: Phil Davis vs. Rob Wilkinson; Antonio Carlos Jr. vs. Karl Moore; Karl Albrektsson vs. Simeon Powell.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview the UFC on ESPN 67 card and the bantamweight main event between Cory Sandhagen (17-5-0) and Deiveson Figueiredo (24-4-1); other bouts on the card include: Reinier de Ridder (19-2) vs. Bo Nickal (7-0) in a middleweight co-main event.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: DIRT: The Last Great American Sport
Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: DIRT: The Last Great American Sport
The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: DIRT: The Last Great American Sport
DIRT: The Last Great American Sport
Driven By Speed: Keanu Reeves vs Cody Jones
programme.desc: Action movie star Keanu Reeves and Cody Jones from Dude Perfect take to the legendary Indianapolis Motor Speedway for a head-to-head race, as all-access footage shows the training and preparation between car and driver leading up to the event.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: DIRT: The Last Great American Sport
PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Teams composed of players represented by bowling ball parent sponsors Brunswick (four teams), Storm (three teams) and independent brand MOTIV (one team) compete in the final event of the season with the winning team earning a $100,000 top prize.

programme.title: The Facility
programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Covering gossip, scandal and the everyday lives of athletes in college and professional sports, the crew comically highlights exclusive footage of the superstars spotted around Hollywood, New York City and other parts of the country.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez moved back into first place and gained a 17-point lead over his brother, Alex, after winning at Qatar for his third win of 2025; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Spain last year over Pedro Acosta.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver claimed a 2-0 lead over Inter Miami in the first leg of the semi-final on April 24 with goals from Brian White and Sebastian Berhalter; Pedro Vite and Jayden Nelson provided the assists for the Whitecaps in the win at home.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver claimed a 2-0 lead over Inter Miami in the first leg of the semi-final on April 24 with goals from Brian White and Sebastian Berhalter; Pedro Vite and Jayden Nelson provided the assists for the Whitecaps in the win at home.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Kyle Larson secured his second win in the last four races with his dominant victory at Bristol over Denny Hamlin, who had his two-race winning streak snapped; Tyler Reddick and Ricky Stenhouse Jr. won the two races at Talladega last year.

programme.title: UFL Football
programme.desc: Memphis (0-4) is still in search of its first win this season, averaging 12.5 ppg in its first four games; Birmingham (3-1), the defending champions, won three-straight games since opening the season with an 18-11 loss to DC on March 30.

programme.title: Kentucky Derby Preview
programme.desc: Analysts preview the upcoming running of the Kentucky Derby, the first of the three Triple Crown races, breaking down the morning-line favorites for the race, recent performances from the horses in the race and their predictions on who wins.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Tigres and Cruz Azul played to a 1-1 draw in the first leg of the semi-final on April 23 where Juan Jos Purata equalized for Tigres in the 85th minute of play; Carlos Rotondi had broken the 0-0 deadlock in the 69th minute of the draw.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Players and teams compete in the seventh event of 2025 for a $25 million purse; Joaquin Niemann won the individual title with a three-shot victory over Lucas Herbert, while Legion XIII won the team crown in the sixth event in Mexico City on April 27.

programme.title: European Poker Tour
programme.desc: Big-money poker events in some of Europe's most exclusive and exciting destinations, features some of the best players in the world attempting to take huge pots by employing the right strategy and taking advantage of their opponents' mistakes.

programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez moved back into first place and gained a 17-point lead over his brother, Alex, after winning at Qatar for his third win of 2025; Francesco Bagnaia won the grand prix race last year over Marc Marquez.

programme.title: Canadian Championship Soccer
programme.desc: Toronto claimed victories against Montral in both of their meetings from the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on July 20 with a 1-0 scoreline; Richie Laryea found the net for the lone goal of the win assisted by Lorenzo Insigne.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: Two weeks prior to event, good water clarity and lake level less than half a foot over the full pool level of 660 feet was reported, with midmorning water temperatures reading around 65 degrees, all of which point to a spawn/postspawn tournament.

programme.title: NHRA Drag Racing
programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in Top Fuel, Pro Stock and Funny Car; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various categories.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Brenden Queen extended his lead over Lavar Scott to 11 points after finishing second at Phoenix, while Brent Crews secured his third Menards Series win of his career; Jake Finch won the race at Talladega last year over Kris Wright.

programme.title: America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: NRL Hits Vegas
programme.desc: The NRL stepped outside of Australia to open its 2024 season under the bright, neon lights of Las Vegas, as the documentary shows all-access footage and interviews with the people that made it happen and the players who got a unique experience.

programme.title: FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: Mauritania enters the tournament coming off of suffering a 6-1 defeat to Senegal in the CAF Beach Soccer AFCON final on Oct. 26; Iran claimed the AFC Beach Soccer Asian Cup with an 8-1 victory against Oman in the final on March 30.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: The 13th FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup, comprised of the host country and the top 15 from six different continental competitions, kicks off with the group stage; Brazil claimed their sixth title when they won the 2024 edition of the tournament.

programme.title: State of Origin
programme.desc: Queensland, which leads the all-time series, 20-5-1, won the title for the fourth time in five years after securing a 22-6 victory in Game 3 of last year's edition, as Shannon Mato earned the Nellie Doherty Medal for Player of the Series.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Inter Miami claimed a 2-1 victory against Vancouver in their lone meeting from the 2024 season on May 25 behind a goal and assist from Robert Taylor; Leonardo Campana doubled Miami's lead before Ryan Gauld converted a penalty for the Whitecaps.

programme.title: FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: The 13th FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup, comprised of the host country and the top 15 nations from six continental competitions, kicks off with the group stage; Brazil claimed their sixth title when they won the 2024 edition of the tournament.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: NRL Rugby League
programme.desc: Parramatta (2-0-5) snapped a two-match losing streak to the Sharks with a 34-22 victory last season, as Maika Sivo notched two tries, while Mitchell Moses added 10 points; Cronulla (4-0-4) suffered a 20-18 setback to Wests Tigers in Round 8.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Omaha claimed victories against Grand Rapids in their first three meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on April 17 with a 3-0 scoreline; Brooke Nuneviller and Cooper Reaggan both had 10 kills for the Supernovas in the win.

programme.title: FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup
programme.desc: The 13th FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup, comprised of the host country and the top 15 nations from six continental competitions, kicks off with the group stage; Brazil claimed their sixth title when they won the 2024 edition of the tournament.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Alabama; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Practice
programme.desc: Indy NXT drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the upcoming race in Alabama; crews work to set up the car.
